alert.note: Alert for Essex; Middlesex; Norfolk; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 08 at 9:16AM EDT until August 08 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by repetitive rounds of heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, eastern, and northeastern Massachusetts, including the following counties, in central Massachusetts, Worcester. In eastern Massachusetts, Middlesex and Norfolk. In northeastern Massachusetts, Essex. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 914 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to heavy showers and embedded thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. While rainfall rates have been as much as one inch per hour, several rounds of showers and thunderstorms are expected. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Worcester, Lowell, Newton, Lawrence, Framingham, Haverhill, Waltham, Medford, Methuen, Arlington, Billerica, Marlborough, Woburn, Shrewsbury, Chelmsford, Andover, Natick, Watertown, Franklin and Lexington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
